subject: Math
goals: Develop a strong understanding of basic algebraic concepts including variables, expressions, and equations. Learn how to simplify algebraic expressions using basic operations and understand the importance of order of operations.
milestones: 1. Understand what variables are and how they are used in algebra. 2. Be able to identify and create algebraic expressions. 3. Gain proficiency in simplifying expressions using the proper order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS).

timetable.session: 2 hours total, split into two 1-hour sessions during the week.

learning_tasks.task: Read through textbook chapters or online materials on variables, expressions, and order of operations.
Watch educational videos providing an introduction to algebraic concepts and demonstrate example problems.

practice_tasks.task: Complete worksheet exercises on identifying and simplifying algebraic expressions.
Perform additional practice problems from the textbook or online resources focusing on expressions, using order of operations.
